question: Which of the following programmes launched by the government aims at tapping the talent pool of engineers in the country to carry out research in the field of science & technology indigenously thereby transforming brain drain into brain gain?
explanation: The Prime Minister Research Fellowship scheme has been launched to facilitate 1,000 B. Tech students for pursuing PhD courses at IITs and IISc. A sum of Rs 1,650 crore for the scheme for a period of seven years, beginning in 2018-19 has been announced in the Budget 2018. Under this scheme, students who have completed or are in the final year of B.Tech or integrated M.Tech or M.Sc in science and technology domains at IISc, IITs, NITs, IIITs will be offered direct admissions in PhD programmes in IITs and IISc. Students, who get shortlisted as per eligibility criteria will also be offered a fellowship of Rs 70,000 a month during the first two years, Rs 75,000 per month during the third year and Rs 80,000 per month during the fourth and the fifth year. This scheme, therefore, will go a long way in tapping the talent pool of engineers in the country for carrying out research indigenously in cutting-edge science and technology domains thereby transforming brain drain into brain gain.
